title: Gainesville Guidepost
name: Gainesville Guidepost
description: A guide to my favorite places in and around Gainesville.

properties.name: Adams Rib Company
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - This place is better than Sonny's, but unfortunately more expensive too.

properties.name: Alachua Sink
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Great place to see alligators.

properties.name: Alley Gatorz
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - A good bowling alley.

properties.name: Bat House
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Drop by the bat house just before dark to see thousands of bats fly out for dinner.

properties.name: Bob's Barber Shop
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - A real barbershop for real men.

properties.name: Cedar Key, FL
properties.description: Aug 30, 2009 - Fish, eat world-class clam chowder, and generally enjoy the pristine beauty of the Gulf coast.

properties.name: Central Florida Office Plus
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Get your art and office supplies here.

properties.name: Christian Study Center
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Lecture series, reading groups, and a pleasantly studious environment. Oh, and coffee too.

properties.name: Contra dance
properties.description: Feb 22, 2009 - Contra dances at the Thelma Boltin Center the third Saturday of every month at 8pm. $7 per person or $5 under 21.

properties.name: Devil's Millhopper
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - An impressive sinkhole.

properties.name: Dorn's Liquors & Wine Warehouse
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Dorn's doesn't just carry the best, they staff experts who can help make the right decision.

properties.name: Duck Pond Neighborhood
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - The Duck Pond area is a good place to walk and see old, historic homes.

properties.name: Dudley Farm Historic Park
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Well preserved and functioning historic farm.

properties.name: Fresh Market
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Buy your meat here. Best butcher and deli anywhere.

properties.name: Gainesville Rock Gym
properties.description: Feb 7, 2009 - This place rocks. Numerous walls of varying complexity, including many for bouldering. A little expensive, but once you pay you can play all day.

properties.name: Gator Skeet & Trap Club
properties.description: Jan 17, 2009 - Skeet and trap shooting range. Good folk there.

properties.name: Harbor Freight Tools
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Cheap tools. Stay away from the power tools.

properties.name: Harn Museum of Art
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - The Harn has a large collection, including a wall of Andy Warhol prints. Admission free.

properties.name: Harry Beckwith Gun Shop
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Gun shop and indoor shooting range. The Pickett family runs the shop now. Coffee's behind the counter, and don't miss the bullet holes in the wall.

properties.name: Hawthorne Trail
properties.description: Jan 28, 2009 - The Hawthorne Trail. Good scenery and exercise. Watch out for elite cyclists with an attitude.

properties.name: Hogtown Creek
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Hogtown Creek is an unlikely but rewarding place to look for shark's teeth.

properties.name: Hyde & Zeke Records
properties.description: Jan 24, 2009 - Hyde & Zeke's carries a large but eclectic selection of vinyl, some used and some new. Hit or miss.

properties.name: Ichetucknee Springs Campground
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - A very rustic campground, off the beaten path. The best part is the backwoods bar. They've got pool tables and maybe even dart boards.

properties.name: Ichetucknee Springs State Park
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - You can tube or - even better - canoe the Ichetucknee River starting from the headsprings. In season, tubers float down bumper-to-bumper. In the wintertime, canoeing is very relaxing and a good chance to see the wildlife.

properties.name: Indigo
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Gainesville's green store.

properties.name: Kanapaha Botanical Gardens
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - The Kanapaha Botanical Gardens are some of the most extensive and varied gardens I've seen. Admission $6.

properties.name: Lake Wauburg
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - There are plenty of outdoor activities at Lake Wauburg for anyone associated with UF.

properties.name: Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings Historic State Park
properties.description: Aug 30, 2009 - Visit the home of author Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings.

properties.name: Newberry's Backyard Bar BQ
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Backyard Bar BQ is a great lunch stop if you're out Newberry way.

properties.name: Northwest Seafood
properties.description: May 10, 2009 - Good place to pick up those Apalachicola oysters.

properties.name: Ole Barn
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - A true honkytonk. Across the street from Satchel's, so it's a great place to hang out while you're waiting for a table. There's a jukebox, arcade games, and of course a pool table. Don't come too late because this joint closes at 10 pm, unless it's really packed out.

properties.name: Palm Point Park
properties.description: May 10, 2009 - This park is a great place to fish from shore. Watch out for gators.

properties.name: Paynes Prairie
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - There's a lot to do at the Prairie. Saw some wild horses driving up 441 today.

properties.name: Pearl Country Store & Barbecue
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - A barbecue joint in a convenience store. Ask for the brisket.

properties.name: Pickett Weaponry
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Gun shop out in Newberry. They have a sizable collection and knowledgeable staff.

properties.name: Rocky Cola II
properties.description: May 10, 2009 - Seafood restaurant. I want to check this out.

properties.name: San Felasco Bike Trails
properties.description: Jan 18, 2009 - Abundant mountain bike trails. Not bad trails, but it's a bummer there aren't any actual mountains. To park, enter through Progress Park. $2 per vehicle/bike to get in.

properties.name: Satchel's Pizza
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - A Gainesville original. Satchel's pizza is the only restaurant I've ever visited that has a map. There's Lightning Salvage, a playground for kids, an outdoor lounge with live music and drinks, a bocce ball court, a greenhouse, and herb garden seating.

properties.name: Sharpe's Music Exchange
properties.description: Jan 24, 2009 - Mr. Sharpe carries a large selection of vintage vinyl records and some CDs too.

properties.name: Sonny's Real Pit Bar-BQ
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - The original Sonny's. That's right, the Waldo Road restaurant was the very first. Did you know Sonny even lives in these parts?

properties.name: Tackle Box
properties.description: May 10, 2009 - A great bait and tackle shop right by Newnan's Lake.

properties.name: The Yearling restaurant
properties.description: Feb 22, 2009 - "The flavor and spirit of Old Florida" in Cross Creek, FL.

properties.name: U-Pick Citrus
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Picked oranges, grapefruits, and kumquats here. Five bucks for a five-gallon bucket full.

properties.name: Volta Coffee
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - This place has a Clover! Need I say more? Seriously, a coffee shop for coffee snobs.

properties.name: Waldo Farmers and Flea Market
properties.description: Dec 16, 2008 - The Waldo flea market is a good place to spend a Saturday afternoon.

properties.name: Ward's Super Market
properties.description: Dec 14, 2008 - Homegrown grocery. Perfectly adapted to the neighborhood. Great produce, bulk foods, beer, and wine. Local goods often available.
